comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content:
Vanitie was a yacht owned by Alexander Smith Cochran that was selected to defend the America's Cup against Sir Thomas Lipton's yacht Resolute.

Vanitie lost to Resolute in the 1914 trials. Defense of the cup was put off during World War I. The 1920 campaign was not successful and Vanitie lost 7-4 in the final selection series
